HTMLOptionsCollection.summary: The HTMLOptionsCollection interface represents a collection of <option> HTML elements (in document order) and offers methods and properties for selecting from the list as well as optionally altering its items. This object is returned only by the options property of select.

HTMLOptionsCollectionAdd.summary: The add() method of the interface adds an or to this HTMLOptionsCollection.

HTMLOptionsCollectionLength.summary: The length property of the interface returns the number of {{htmlelement("option")}} elements in the collection. The property can get or set the size of the collection.

remarks.para: When setting length to a value smaller than the current, the options collection gets truncated; otherwise, new blank <option> elements are appended to the end of the <select>.

HTMLOptionsCollectionLength.value: An integer value representing the number of items in this HTMLOptionsCollection.

HTMLOptionsCollectionRemove.summary: The remove() method of the interface removes the {{HTMLelement("option")}} element specified by the index from this collection.

HTMLOptionsCollectionSelectedIndex.summary: The selectedIndex property of the interface is the numeric index of the first selected {{HTMLElement("option")}} element, if any, or âˆ’1 if no <option> is selected. Setting this property selects the option at that index and deselects all other options in this collection, while setting it to -1 deselects any currently selected elements. It is exactly equivalent to the property of the that owns this collection.
